results.title: The New South Asia
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, United Nations. Film Board and Donald Fraser
results.brief_description: A report on social and economic conditions in the five nations of southern Asia. The film portrays the surge of independence and determination to work out their own future which has permeated every phase of national life for this one-fourth of the world’s population, and which is bringing advances in health and living standards. The assistance of the United Nations in providing the knowledge and the plans with which to develop education, social welfare, agriculture and industry is shown.

results.title: The New ship
results.creator_credit: Department of the Navy and Tony Eggleton
results.brief_description: Shows the Royal Australian Navy’s first American built vessel, the guided missile destroyer Perth, with scenes of the crew in training and at leisure in America, the delivery and commissioning ceremony.

results.title: The New rangers
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and David Roberts
results.brief_description: Looks at the new breed of rangers being trained at Kakadu National Park. The training program is for Aboriginals whose families have been the traditional owners of the area. The aim is that Kakadu will be managed and run by the Aboriginal people, who will pass on a little of their culture to the visitors who come to see the park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Don Murray and David Roberts

results.title: The New pattern
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Stanley Hawes and Fred Lasse
results.brief_description: This account of Labor-Management Production Committees in the construction industry in wartime Britain takes as an example the building of an airfield, and shows some of the problems involved in a construction job of this kind. The film also demonstrates the methods of election of the men’s representatives on the Committee, the discussion and decisions of the Committee and how the Committee acts as a channel for suggestions by the men for improving production efficiency. As a result relations between management and men are good, everyone works together to get on with the job, and the speed of construction is accelerated.

results.title: The New mine
results.brief_description: A study of a modern colliery at Comrie, in Scotland. Comrie is a challenge to coalmine owners. It has been fully mechanised with the most modern coal-hewing and safety equipment; ventilation throughout the mine is constant and controlled, and every amenity and safety measure to help the men who work underground is in use. In addition, the surface works are well planned, so that slagheaps and railway-yards do not deface the countryside.

results.title: The New materials frontier
results.brief_description: Prospects for the development of new materials are almost limitless as scientists understand how the properties of materials relate to their internal structures, and can thus design materials to meet specific requirements. This program outlines the classification of materials into categories of metals, ceramics, polymers and composites. The general properties of each, as related to their different atomic or molecular bonding is also discussed. The way their atoms or electrons are arranged and the subsequent characteristics of each type of material is also covered.

results.title: The New librarians
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts, Henri Bagdadi and Michael Bloebaum
results.brief_description: A panoramic view of the exciting changes occurring in schools, public and business libraries. Shows the importance of a library to the population it serves. The new librarians are reaching out to the public via mobile units, jazz sessions, video tape, computers, etc
